label: A11B4_cF120_227_acdf_e-001
title: $\gamma$-Ga$_{2}$O$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
Ga$_{2}$O$_{3}$ exhibits a variety of structures: \begin{itemize} \item $\alpha$Ga$_{2}$O$_{3}$, which has the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_hR10_167_c_e-001}{corundum ($D5_{1}$) structure} , \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_mC20_12_2i_3i-001}{$\beta$Ga$_{2}$O$_{3}$}, \item $\gamma$Ga$_{2}$O$_{3}$, this structure, and \item $\epsilon$Ga$_{2}$O$_{3}$, a structure with many vacancies which can be approximated by the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_oP40_33_4a_6a-001}{$\kappa$ alumina structure}. \end{itemize} \vspace{-.25in} ~ 
 In $\gamma$Ga$_{2}$O$_{3}$ none of the gallium sites have full occupancy.  Ga-I and Ga-II are 74.1\% occupied, Ga-III is 6.6\% occupied, and Ga-IV is only 2.4\% occupied.
